ENTPD1 (CD39), ectonucleoside triphosphate diphosphohydrolase 1, is expressed by B cells, innate cells, regulatory T-cells as well as activated CD4 and CD8 T-cells (PMID: 30006565). CD39 converts ATP to adenosine to regulate cellular homeostasis and functions as an immune checkpoint inhibitor and is a marker for exhausted T-cells in patients with chronic viral infections (PMID: 29914571; PMID: 30006565)

HAVCR2, also known as the Tim-3 protein, is a member of the T-cell immunoglobilin and mucin domain (Tim) family and expressed on  differentiated TH1 cells (PMID: 24825777). TIM3 has possible role in dampening the immune response and in contributing to a tumor's ability to acquire resistance to the immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 31733828)

IL1B, interleukin 1 beta, is a member of the interleukin 1 cytokine family. ProIL-1B is produced by monocytes and macrophages but requires cleavage by capase to produce its active form (PMID:15188375). IL1B induces T-cells to proliferate and produce IFN-g without TCR engagement (PMID:10653850).

MAGEA4, melanoma-associated antigen 4, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family (PMID: 28300603), and regulates cell growth (PMID: 22842486). MAGEA4 may provide a marker for immunotherapy due to its severe prognosis in numerous cancers (PMID: 12209610)

PVR (CD155), poliovirus receptor, is an immunoglobulin-like molecule with three Ig-like domains and localizes in cell-matrix adhesions and cell-cell junctions (PMID: 15194502).  PVR overexpresison promotes cell migration, cell proliferation, and enhances growth factor-induced cell proliferation (PMID: 28730595).

TNFSF4 (OX40L), tumor necrosis factor ligand superfamily member 4, is expressed on antigen presenting cells and co-stimulates T-cells through binding of TNFRSF4 (OX40) to induce cell proliferation and survival of T-cells in autoimmunity responses (PMID: 28092803, PMID: 26215166).

CXCR2 is a chemokine and a membrane bound G-protein coupled receptor that is expressed on neutrophils, monocytes, lymphocytes and NK cells (PMID:22850671; PMID: 30319622). Activation of CXCR2 is important for the recruitment of neutrophils to a site of infection (PMID: 22850671 )

GZMB, granzyme B,  is a granule associated serine protease that is induced when t-cells and NK cells acquire cytotoxic function (PMID: 8258716). GZMB plays a central role in killing human tumor cell lines, along with inducing cell death and apoptosis (PMID: 29669300)

ICOS, inducible co-stimulator, is a member of the CD28 family. ICOS enhances basic T-cell responses to foreign antigens such as proliferation, secretion of lymphokines, upregulation of molecules that mediate cell-cell interaction and effective help for antibody secretion by B-cells (PMID: 9930702; PMID:11169414)

IL10, interleukin 10, encodes for an anti-inflammatory cytokine that is involved in the regulation of the immune response (PMID: 18424693). IL10 expression has been linked to immune protection in cancer (PMID: 24076584).

LAG3, lymphocyte activation gene 3 protein, is expressed on activated T-cells and NK cells and binds MHC class II molecules to inhibit the immune response (PMID: 28258692). LAG3 inhibition in cancer therapy may relieve suppression of the anti-tumor immune response (PMID: 29900067, PMID: 29439955).

MAGEA3, melanoma-associated antigen 3, is a member of the cancer testis antigen (CTA) family that has normal, restricted expression in the testis (PMID: 30588194). MAGEA3 is often correlated with poor prognosis and resistance to immune checkpoint blockade (PMID: 29656892).

MS4A1, membrane spanning 4-domains A1, is a cell surface marker for mature B-cells that potentially regulates B-cell activation and growth (PMID: 11225995). MS4A1 is expressed in B-cell originated tumors and is a therapeutic target (PMID: 6609729, PMID: 19687518).

TBX21 (T-bet), T-box transcription factor 21 ,  is a transcription factor that directs Th1 cell differentiation (PMID:27292648). TBX21 transactivates the IFNgamma gene, induces IFNgamma production in retrovirally transduced primary T-cells and redirects polarized Th2 cells into the Th1 pathway (PMID: 10761931: PMID:27292648)

TNF, tumor necrosis factor, is a cytokine member of the TNF superfamily (PMID: 29484738) and is mainly produced by macrophages in response to inflammation (PMID: 30585274). TNF is released rapidly after injury with short kinetics, however prolonged TNF production is associated with pathology (PMID: 27726761)

TNFRSF9 (4-1BB/CD137), TNF Receptor Superfamily Member 9, is a costimulatory receptor expressed on activated T-cells (PMID:22406983). CD137 promotes cellular proliferation, survival, cytokine production and plays a role in the differentiation of effector memory CTLs (PMID:22406983; PMID: 12384425)

TNFRSF18, (GITR) TNF Receptor Superfamily Member 18, is upregulated after T-cell receptor stimulation. TNFRSF18 is involved in the inhibition of T-cell receptor induced apoptosis and upregulation of inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS) (PMID: 15326137; PMID: 9177197). GITR also plays a pivotal role in regulating the suppressive function of CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells (PMID: 15326137)

ABL1, ABL proto-oncogene 1, non-receptor tyrosine kinase, plays a role in regulation of cell growth through ERK5, Rac/JNK, and Stat1/3 pathways (PMID: 10373409). A number of Abl1 mutations in the context of BCR-ABL1 have been demonstrated to confer drug resistance (PMID: 24456693).

C11orf30, EMSY Transcriptional Repressor, BRCA2 Interacting gene,  plays a role in transciptional regulation resulting in silencing (PMID: 24582497). EMSY silences BRCA2 by binding BRCA2 within exon 3 deleted in cancer (PMID: 24582497; PMID: 14651845)

FAM46C, or Terminal Nucleotidyltransferase 5C (TENT5C) is a member of the nucleotidyltransferase superfamily (PMID: 28619709). FAM46C enhances the replication of certain viruses and is related to the regulation of translation (PMID: 27060136)

GNA11, G protein subunit alpha 11, is a guanine nucleotide-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNA11 hotspot mutations impair intrinsic Gna11 GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356, PMID: 29209985).

GPR124, or Adhesion G Protein-Couple Receptor A2 (ADGRA2), is an orphan adhesion GPCR and plays an essential role in blood brain barrier formation (PMID: 31058365). GPR forms a multiprotein complex with Reck that enhances Wnt signating in the CNS endothelial cells leading to cell migration and differentiation (PMID: 31534530; PMID: 31058365)

H3F3B is an H3.3 variant histone that is expressed throughout the cell cycle (PMID: 15776021). H3.3 interacts with the HIRA histone chaperone that is necessary to mediate DNA-synthesis independet nuclosome assembly respectively (PMID: 14718166; PMID: 15776021)

FAM123B, APC Membrane Recruitment Protein 1 (AMER1), or WTX,  is an X-chromosome gene that recruits APC (a tumor suppressor protein) to the plasma membrane (PMID: 21498506; PMID: 17925383). AMER1 is a regulatory of the WNT signalling pathway by forming a complex with - catenin (PMID: 17510365)

FAM175A, Abraxas 1, BRCA1 A Complex Subunit that binds BRCA1 forming a complex with with BACH1 and CTIP. Abraxas recruits ibiquitin interacting motif (UIM) containing Rap80 , both of which are required for DNA damage resistance (PMID: 17525340; PMID:17643122)

FGFR2, fibroblast growth factor receptor 2, is a receptor tyrosine kinase activated upon binding of the FGF ligand, which activates RAS-MAPK and PI3K-AKT pathways (PMID: 22508544).  Altered function of FGFR2 through activating mutations, fusions, and amplification increases cell proliferation and tumorigenesis (PMID: 22508544).

GNAQ, G protein subunit alpha q, is a guanine-binding protein (G protein) subunit, which is activated following ligand binding to G-protein coupled receptors and functions in cell signaling (PMID: 27148356). GNAQ hotspot mutations impair intrinsic GTPase activity, resulting in constitutive pathway activation (PMID: 23640210, PMID: 27148356)
H3F3C is a histsone variant that is highly expressed in the human testis. H3.5 nucleosome is unstable, and it accumulates around transcription start sites (PMID: 29179259)

GSK3B, glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta, is a serine-threonine kinase that is involved in glycogen synthesis, regulates proteosomal degradation of signaling molecules including beta-catenin, Ccnd1, Myc, and Jun (PMID: 11563964, PMID: 29379583), and also promotes cell survival through activation of NF-kappaB signaling (PMID: 28053024).

H3F3A is an H3.3 variant histone that is expressed throughout the cell cycle (PMID: 15776021). H3.3 interacts with the HIRA histone chaperone that is necessary to mediate DNA-synthesis independet nuclosome assembly respectively (PMID: 14718166; PMID: 15776021)
